children.subject: How would you recommending preparing for cs 70 if I were to take it first semester along with cs 61a, eecs 16a, and a h/ss?

I did a similar courseload in my first semester: CS 61A, EECS 16A, CS 70, and a H/SS. I found it very reasonable. I would recommend starting off with this and then dropping from classes if you realize the workload is too much. Given your background, though, I'd think you can handle it but only you can really determine whether that's the case.

history.content: This workload is fine, a lot people do 3 techs and a breadth per semester. As mentioned in student answer below, enroll in all the classes and drop if needed. Also as far as I'm aware major specific advising is generally good, but I recommend doing advising over zoom instead of email

Hello everyone,

Did anyone take 3 technical classes and 1 H/SS class their first semester at Berkeley? Or the recommended 2 technical and one breath class? How was the workload? Did you do well?

I am a new transfer student. In Fall, I want to take 15 units: EECS 16A, CS 70, CS 100, and MECHENG 191K (3 units, H/SS, no final). I already took discrete math, linear algebra and Data 8 at community college, so I have some background.

My advisor just sent me comments on my proposed schedule, telling me to take only 2 technicals and 1 H/SS. Honestly, her feedback seems like a generic copy-paste message with names of my proposed classes inserted, so I am not sure if it is a good idea to follow her advice. For example, she recommended me to take an upper-division class that satisfies American Cultures requirement (I already satisfied that) and retake CS 61B (I already took equivalent). Her proposed schedule (EECS 16A, (CS 100 or CS 61B), and H/SS) is bad because CS 70 is a prerequisite for ML classes that I want to take and I have only 4 semesters left.

Advising at my CC was really bad. My advisor made a wrong transfer plan, causing me to stay at CC one more year, and told me to take light load my first semester, making me bored.

Is advising at Berkeley good or bad? Is it worth following the advice?
history.subject: Workload for new student

history.content:
Hello everyone,

Did anyone take 3 technical classes and 1 H/SS class their first semester at Berkeley? Or the recommended 2 technical and one breath class? How was the workload? Did you do well?

I am a new transfer student. In Fall, I want to take 15 units: EECS 16A, CS 70, CS 100, and MECHENG 191K (3 units, H/SS). I already took discrete math, linear algebra and Data 8 at community college, so I have some background.

My advisor just sent me comments on my proposed schedule, telling me to take only 2 technicals and 1 H/SS. Honestly, her feedback seems like a generic copy-paste message, so I am not sure if I should follow it. For example, she recommended me to take an upper-division class that satisfies American Cultures requirement (I already satisfied that) and retake CS 61B (I already took equivalent). Her proposed schedule: EECS 16A, (CS 100 or CS 61B) and H/SS. When I started community college, my advisor also recommended that I take it easy my first semester and I was incredibly bored. I don't want to make the same mistake.
history.subject: Workload for new student
